e4: While the CFO raises valid concerns about potential short-term stock price impact, I believe that adopting the new policy is in the best interest of the company and its stakeholders. By reporting unbiased earnings, we promote transparency and accountability, reducing the risk of regulatory issues and potential lawsuits. This approach also aligns with our responsibility to provide accurate information to investors, allowing them to make informed decisions. In the long run, I believe that the benefits of a transparent reporting policy will outweigh any temporary market adjustments.
e5: I view an ethical reporting policy as one that prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness. Key characteristics include unbiased presentation of financial information, clarity in disclosure, and consistency in methodology. Additionally, consideration should be given to the needs and understanding of various stakeholder groups, including retail investors who may lack sophistication. A reporting policy should also take into account the broader regulatory environment and ensure compliance with relevant laws and standards. Finally, an ethical reporting policy is one that balances short-term considerations with long-term sustainability and accountability.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team to provide more information on how they plan to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors and analysts. Specifically, I would like to know what steps they will take to ensure a smooth transition, what disclosures they will make about the change, and how they will address potential concerns from retail investors who may be adversely affected. Additionally, I would also ask for an assessment of any potential risks or unintended consequences of adopting the new policy.
